sen.j: 棟札（むなふだ、むねふだ）は、寺社・民家など建物の建築・修築の記録・記念として、棟木・梁など建物内部の高所に取り付けた札である。
sen.e: Munefuda is a tag put on a higher place of the building interior such as "muneki or munegi" (member put at the highest place) and "hari or ryo" (member which supports the load of the ceiling or floor) as a record and remembrance of the construction and renovation of the buildings such as temples and shrines and private residences.

A munefuda is a tag affixed to the inside of buildings such as temples, shrines or private residences, placed in a high position such as on a roof beam, as a record of or to commemorate the construction or renovation of the building.
sen.cmt: Rewritten. I don't feel the Japanese "muneki" or "hari" add anything to the meaning and could potentially confuse the reader, so these have been removed.

sen.j: 典型的には、木の札または銅の板に記して釘で打ち付ける。
sen.e: Typically, wood tags or copper boards on which the records are described are nailed.
Typically, wooden tags or copper boards on which the records are inscribed are attached with nails.

sen.j: 中には建物の部材に直接記されることもあり、これを梁上銘と呼ぶこともあるが、趣旨は同じである。
sen.e: Sometimes the records are described directly on the member of the buildings and they are called "ryojomei," but the purpose is the same as "muneki."

sen.j: 書かれる内容は築造・修理の目的を記した意趣文やその年月日や建築主・大工の名・工事の目的など建築記録だが、関連して他の事に及ぶものもある。
sen.e: The described contents are the sentences for the purpose of construction and renovation and the construction records such as the dates, the main constructors, the names of carpenters, the purposes of constructions and so on, but the other things concerning these are also described.

The messages they contain allude to the purpose of construction and renovation and construction records such as dates, the main constructors, the names of carpenters, among other references to things concerning the building.

sen.j: 簡潔なものもあれば、詳細に記されたもの、絵柄が記されたものなど多種多様である。
sen.e: They are of great variety such as the simple ones, the detailed ones, the ones which have the pictures and so on.
They are of great variety and stretch from simple ones to detailed ones, to ones which contain pictures.

sen.j: 棟札は普通の利用者には見えない位置に取り付けられるため、年月か経つとしばしば存在が忘れられてしまう。
sen.e: Munefuda is put on the place which the normal users cannot look at, and as time goes by it is often forgotten.
Munefuda are put in places which are not usually viewed, and as time goes by they are often forgotten.

sen.j: そうした棟札が解体・修理の際に発見されることがある。
sen.e: When the buildings are torn down or repaired, such munefudas are sometimes discovered.

sen.j: 棟札に記されていることは誤記などもあるが、その建物をはじめその地域の歴史や文化に関する重要な歴史的史料となり、文化財に指定されているものも多い。
sen.e: The descriptions on munefudas have some errors, but they are the important historical sources on the buildings and the history or culture of the area and many of them are registered as cultural properties.

sen.j: 最古の棟札は、岩手県中尊寺の保安 (日本)3年（1122年）銘をもつものであるという。
sen.e: The oldest munefuda is the one written in 1122 and stored in the Chusonji temple in Iwate prefecture.
